name: Avoid using READ statement without AT END clause or INVALID KEY clause
description:
This rule searches for COBOL programs using READ statements without the AT END or INVALID KEY clause.

Notes:
- READ statements executed against QSAM files should have an AT END clause. 
- READ statements executed against VSAM files should have an INVALID KEY clause. 
- No violation is raised on files for which the SELECT ASSIGN clause has not been found. This can occur when copybooks are missing.
output:
Associated to each COBOL Program with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- The number of violation patterns
- Bookmarks for violation patterns found in the source code:
  - READ statement
rationale: When reading data from files, it is important to manage all the situations that can occur and especially when there is no data to read. If the "end of file" is not managed or if a key is not found, then invalid data can be read and abnormal behavior can occur.
remediation: Insert a AT END or INVALID KEY clause to READ statements in order to manage errors and end of file situations.
remediationSample:
* Example 1 
            SELECT F-CARS 
            ASSIGN TO "CARS". 
            ... 
            1000-READ-DATA. 
            READ CARDIN INTO PEMPNO 
               AT END MOVE 'N' TO INPUT-SWITCH 
            END-READ 

        PERFORM PROCESS-DATA. 

            * Example 2 
            SELECT F-CARS 
            ASSIGN TO "CARS" 
            ORGANIZATION INDEXED 
            ACCESS RANDOM 
            RECORD KEY CAR-ID. 
            ... 
            1000-READ-DATA. 
            READ F-CARS 
                INVALID KEY 
                MOVE 'N' TO INPUT-SWITCH 
            END-READ 

            PERFORM PROCESS-DATA. .
